tit.cmt: 以下説明が続くため、英語説明は削除しました。

sen.j: 三弦（さんげん）は、日本の伝統楽器である三味線の別称。
sen.e: "Sangen" is another name of "shamisen," the Japanese traditional musical instrument.
"Sangen" is another name for the shamisen, a Japanese traditional musical instrument.
"Sangen" is another name for the shamisen, a Japanese traditional musical instrument.

sen.j: また、三本の木や鋼材など使った建築物なども三弦の構造形式といわれる。
sen.e: And the architectural style using a set of three chunks of lumber, or steel, is also called sangen.
The architectural style using a set of three pieces of lumber, or steel, is also called sangen.
The architectural style using a set of three pieces of lumber, or steel, is also called sangen.

sen.j: 三曲界、特に地歌・箏曲では、三弦または三絃という場合が多い。
sen.e: The instrument is often written as "三弦" (which reads as sangen) or "三絃" (which also reads as sangen) in the community of "sankyoku" (the instrumental trio, i.e. shamisen, "koto" [the thirteen-stringed Japanese zither], and "shakuhachi" [the bamboo flute] - occasionally, "kokyu" [the Chinese fiddle] instead of shakuhachi), and this is especially true in the community of "Jiuta" (songs of the country accompanied by shamisen) and "Sokyoku" (the music of koto).

The instrument is often expressed as "三弦" (which reads as "sangen") or "三絃" (which also reads as "sangen") in the community of "sankyoku" (the instrumental trio, i.e., shamisen, "koto" [the thirteen-string Japanese zither], and "shakuhachi" [the bamboo flute] or occasionally "kokyu" [the Chinese fiddle] instead of shakuhachi), and this is particularly true in the community of "Jiuta" (songs of the country accompanied by shamisen) and "Sokyoku" (the music of the koto).

The instrument is often expressed as "三弦" (which reads as "sangen") or "三絃" (which also reads as "sangen") in the community of "sankyoku" (the instrumental trio, i.e., shamisen, koto (the thirteen-string Japanese zither), and shakuhachi (the bamboo flute) or occasionally kokyu (the Chinese fiddle) instead of shakuhachi), and this is particularly true in the community of Jiuta (songs of the country accompanied by shamisen) and Sokyoku (the music of the koto).

sen.j: 特に公式の文書、プログラムなどには三弦、三絃と記される。
sen.e: Specifially on a formal document, or on a performance program, this instrument is written as "三弦" or "三絃."
Specifially in a formal document or a performance program, this instrument is expressed as "三弦" or "三絃."
Specifically in a formal document or a performance program, this instrument is expressed as "三弦" or "三絃."

sen.j: 日常使われる場合はさほど厳密ではなく、三味線という語も使われる。
sen.e: But in a usual case, the usage of the term is not so strict, and the term shamisen is also used for sangen.
Normally, however, the use of the term isn't so strict, and the term "shamisen" is also used for sangen.
Normally, however, the use of the term isn't so strict, and the term "shamisen" is also used for sangen.

sen.j: 現代邦楽では、地歌系以外の三味線にも使うことが多い。
sen.e: In today's Japanese music, the term sangen is used also on the occasion that the instrument is played for the music other than Jiuta.
In today's Japanese music, the term "sangen" is used also on the occasion that the instrument is played for music other than Jiuta.
In today's Japanese music, the term "sangen" is used also on the occasion that the instrument is played for music other than Jiuta.

sen.j: （例 『三絃四重奏曲』（杵屋正邦作曲・長唄、地歌、常磐津、義太夫の各三味線のための曲）、『二種の三絃のためのソナタ』（藤井凡大作曲・地歌および長唄三味線のための曲）
sen.e: For example, the term sangen is used in some titles, such as "Sangen shijuso kyoku" (A sangen quartet), composed by Seiho KINEYA for shamisen performed in "Nagauta" (ballads sung to shamisen accompaniment), Jiuta, "Tokiwazu" (dramatic narrative chants accompanied by shamisen) and "Gidayu" (a style of chanting with shamisen), & "Sonata for two types of sangen," composed by Bondai FUJII for shamisen performed in Jiuta and Nagauta).
sen.cmt: ・①「常磐津」②「義太夫」の英訳については以下のホームページを参照しました。[http://jtrad.columbia.jp/eng/j-gidayu.html] (①）http://jtrad.columbia.jp/eng/j-tokiwazu.html]（②）
sen.e: For example, the term sangen is used in some titles, such as "Sangen shijuso kyoku (A sangen quartet)," composed by Seiho KINEYA for shamisen as performed in "Nagauta" (ballads sung to shamisen accompaniment), Jiuta, "Tokiwazu" (dramatic narrative chants accompanied by shamisen) and "Gidayu" (a style of chanting with shamisen), and "Sonata for two types of sangen," composed by Bondai FUJII for shamisen performed in Jiuta and Nagauta).

For example, the term sangen is used in some titles, such as "Sangen shijuso kyoku" (A sangen quartet), composed by Seiho KINEYA for shamisen as performed in Nagauta (ballads sung to shamisen accompaniment), Jiuta, Tokiwazu (dramatic narrative chants accompanied by shamisen) and Gidayu (a style of chanting with shamisen), and "Sonata for two types of sangen," composed by Bondai FUJII for shamisen performed in Jiuta and Nagauta).

sen.j: 雅語として「みつのお（三つの緒）」と呼ぶ場合もある。
sen.e: The sangen is occasionally called "mitsuno-o," which literally means "three strings," in a Japanese classical expression.
The sangen is occasionally called "mitsuno-o," literally meaning "three strings," in a Japanese classical expression.
The sangen is occasionally called 'mitsuno-o,' literally meaning three strings, in a Japanese classical expression.

sen.j: 雅楽で、和琴、楽箏、楽琵琶の総称。
sen.e: In Gagaku (ancient Japanese court music), sangen is used as the general term of "wagon" (the Japanese harp), "gakugoto" (the koto used in gagaku) & "gakubiwa" ("biwa" [the Japanese lute] used in gagaku).

In Gagaku (ancient Japanese court music), sangen is used as the general term for "wagon" (the Japanese harp), "gakugoto" (the koto used in gagaku) and "gakubiwa" ("biwa" [the Japanese lute] used in gagaku).
In Gagaku (ancient Japanese court music), sangen is used as the general term for wagon (the Japanese harp), gakugoto (the koto used in gagaku) and gakubiwa (biwa (the Japanese lute) used in gagaku).

sen.j: 琉球（沖縄）の伝統楽器である三線の別称。
sen.e: And sangen is another name of "sanshin," which is a traditional three-stringed instrument handed down in "Ryukyu" (another name of Okinawa).
And sangen is another name for the sanshin, a traditional three-stringed instrument that has been handed down in "Ryukyu" (another name for Okinawa).
And sangen is another name for the sanshin, a traditional three-stringed instrument that has been handed down in Ryukyu (another name for Okinawa).

sen.j: 詳しくは、三味線の項目を参照。
sen.e: For details, please refer to the article of "shamisen."
For details, please refer to the article on the shamisen.
For details, please refer to the article on the shamisen.

sen.j: 以下は中国の伝統楽器としての三弦を記述する。
sen.e: The explanation below is about "sanxian," the traditional Chinese instrument.
sen.cmt: ・中国の楽器としての「三弦」は、同じ漢字が使われていても日本のとは別の楽器です。そのことがはっきりするよう、以下では英訳でも基本的に中国語読みに従って"sanxian" と表記しています(英語圏でも、この表記が一般的に使われています）。
sen.e: The explanation below is about the "sanxian," a traditional Chinese instrument.
The explanation below is about the sanxian, a traditional Chinese instrument.

sen.j: 三弦（サンシェン）(あるいは三絃、意味は文字通り「三つの弦」)は、中国の伝統楽器で、ロングネックリュートタイプの撥弦楽器である。
sen.e: "Sanxian" literally means "three strings," and this is a traditional, lute-like stringed Chinese instrument with a long neck.
"Sanxian" literally means "three strings," and this is a traditional, lute-like Chinese stringed instrument with a long neck.
Sanxian literally means three strings, and this is a traditional, lute-like Chinese stringed instrument with a long neck.

sen.j: 弦子とも言われる。
sen.e: It is also called "xianzi" in China.
It's also referred to as "xianzi" in China.
It's also referred to as xianzi in China.

sen.j: 全長は90cmから120cm程度で、一般的に、南方のものは小さく95cm程度、北方のものは大きく120cm程度の大きさである。
sen.e: The full length of the sanxian ranges from 90 cm to 120 cm, and in general, that of the southern one is about 95 cm, while that of the northern one is about 120 cm.
The full length of the sanxian ranges from 90 cm to 120 cm, but generally that of the southern one is about 95 cm while that of the northern one is about 120 cm.
The full length of the sanxian ranges from 90 cm to 120 cm, but generally that of the southern one is about 95 cm while that of the northern one is about 120 cm.

sen.j: 丸みを帯びた形の胴体（共鳴箱）に蛇の皮を張り、フレットの無い長い棹を持つ。
sen.e: The Sanxian has a rounded body (resonator) covered with snakeskin, and has a fretless long neck.
The Sanxian has a rounded body (resonator) covered with snakeskin, and it has a long, fretless neck.
The Sanxian has a rounded body (resonator) covered with snakeskin, and it has a long, fretless neck.

sen.j: 弦は絹糸を使用する。
sen.e: It has silk threads as strings.
It has silk threads for strings.
It has silk threads for strings.

sen.j: 湿度に影響されやすい。
sen.e: It is susceptible to humidity.
It is susceptible to humidity.
It is susceptible to humidity.

sen.j: 大きいものは約三オクターブの音域がある。
sen.e: The larger one has a range of about three octaves.
The larger one has a range of about three octaves.
The larger one has a range of about three octaves.

sen.j: 歴史的に歌の伴奏楽器として人気があった。
sen.e: Historically, the sanxian has been popular as an accompaniment instrument for a song.
Historically, the sanxian has been popular as an instrument for the accompaniment of songs.
Historically, the sanxian has been popular as an instrument for the accompaniment of songs.

sen.j: 多くの演奏家が、ケース内の湿気を取り除くためケースにシリカゲルを入れる。
sen.e: Many musicians put silica gel in the instrument case to remove the humidity.
Many musicians put silica gel in the instrument case to absorb humidity.
Many musicians put silica gel in the instrument case to absorb humidity.

sen.j: 現代中国のオーケストラではあまり使われない。
sen.e: In today's Chinese orchestra, the performance of the sanxian is not so often.
The sanxian is rarely used in today's Chinese orchestra performances.
The sanxian is rarely used in today's Chinese orchestra performances.

sen.j: 琵琶などと比べてオリジナルのソロのレパートリーは少ない。
sen.e: Compared with other stringed instruments, such as "biwa" (the Japanese lute), the original solo repertoire of the sanxian is few.
Compared with other stringed instruments such as the biwa (the Japanese lute), there is little original solo material in the sanxian's repertoire.
Compared with other stringed instruments such as the biwa (the Japanese lute), there is little original solo material in the sanxian's repertoire.

sen.j: またしばしば中国琵琶とテクニックを共有し、中国琵琶のために伝統的に書かれた曲を演奏することがある。
sen.e: The sanxian & the Chinese lute have many performance skills in common, so the tunes traditionally composed for the Chinese lute are performed with the sanxian occasionally.
The sanxian and Chinese lute have many performance skills in common, so the tunes traditionally composed for the Chinese lute are occasionally performed with the sanxian.
The sanxian and Chinese lute have many performance skills in common, so the tunes traditionally composed for the Chinese lute are occasionally performed with the sanxian.

sen.j: 三弦がトレモロ演奏を行っている場合、元の曲は中国琵琶のために書かれた曲であったりする。
sen.e: If a tune is performed with tremolo picking of the sanxian, its original tune is, in many caes, composed for the Chinese lute.
If a tune is performed on the sanxian with tremolo picking, its original tune is in many cases composed for the Chinese lute.
If a tune is performed on the sanxian with tremolo picking, its original tune is in many cases composed for the Chinese lute.

sen.j: 異なる役割のためのいくつかのサイズがある（大三弦など）。
sen.e: For their various uses, various sizes of sanxian exist, such as the large northern Chinese sanxian.
For their various uses, various sizes of sanxian exist, such as the large northern Chinese sanxian.
For their various uses, various sizes of sanxian exist, such as the large northern Chinese sanxian.

sen.j: また二十世紀になり、四弦のものが開発されている。
sen.e: And in the 20th century, the four-stringed sanxian was devised.
Also, in the twentieth century the four-string sanxian was devised.
Also, in the twentieth century the four-string sanxian was devised.

sen.j: 南管や江南糸竹などのアンサンブルで用いられる。
sen.e: The sanxian is used in ensembles, such as those of nanguan & Jiangnan sizhu.
The sanxian is used in ensembles, such as those of nanguan and Jiangnan sizhu.
The sanxian is used in ensembles, such as those of nanguan and Jiangnan sizhu.

sen.j: 一般的に古典的な中国の音楽にて使用されるが、現代中国のロックミュージシャン何勇(He Yong)が使用したこともある。
sen.e: In general, the sanxian is used in classical Chinese music, but once it was used by He Yong, a rock musician of today's China.
Generally, the sanxian is used in classical Chinese music, but it has also been used by He Yong, a rock musician of today's China.
Generally, the sanxian is used in classical Chinese music, but it has also been used by He Yong, a rock musician of today's China.

sen.j: 日本の三味線との対比
sen.e: Comparison with the Japanese shamisen
Comparison with the Japanese shamisen
Comparison with the Japanese shamisen

sen.j: 胴体の両面には猫の皮ではなく蛇の皮を張る。
sen.e: On both sides of the body, the sanxian uses snakeskin, while the shamisen uses cat skin;
The sides of the sanxian's body consist of snakeskin, but the shamisen uses cat skin;
The sides of the sanxian's body consist of snakeskin, but the shamisen uses cat skin;

sen.j: （ちなみに沖縄の三線は蛇皮）
sen.e: incidentally, the Okinawan sanshin uses snakeskin.
incidentally, the Okinawan sanshin uses snakeskin.
Incidentally, the Okinawan sanshin uses snakeskin.

sen.j: 象牙のバチではなく、人差し指の指先につけたピックで演奏する（現代ではプラスチック製のピックが主流）。
sen.e: The Sanxian is performed with a pick on a player's forefinger, while the shamisen is perfromed with a pick made of ivory; at present, a plastic pick is popular about the sanxian.
The sanxian is played with a pick on the performer's forefinger, while the shamisen is play with an ivory pick; however, plastic picks are now popular for use with the sanxian.
The sanxian is played with a pick on the performer's forefinger, while the shamisen is play with an ivory pick; however, plastic picks are now popular for use with the sanxian.

sen.j: 音色は三味線より太く、重い。
sen.e: The tone of the sanxian is heavier and thicker than that of the shamisen.
The tone of the sanxian is heavier and thicker than that of the shamisen.
The tone of the sanxian is heavier and thicker than that of the shamisen.

sen.j: 調弦法にはいろいろあるが、三味線でいう二上り、三味線の本調子に取ることがよくある。
sen.e: The Sanxian has various tuning methods, and in most cases, it adopts the method similar to "niagari" (raising the second string, originally a tuning method of the shamisen), or another method similar to "hon-choshi" (the main tuning, originally a tuning method of the shamisen).
sen.cmt: ※「二上り」「本調子」の解説部分は以下のホームページを参照しました。[http://jtrad.columbia.jp/eng/i_shamisen.html]
sen.e: The sanxian employs various tunings, and in most cases it adopts a method similar to "niagari" (raising the second string, originally a tuning method of the shamisen) or another method similar to "hon-choshi" (the main tuning, originally for the shamisen).

The sanxian employs various tunings, and in most cases it adopts a method similar to niagari (raising the second string, originally a tuning method of the shamisen) or another method similar to hon-choshi (the main tuning, originally for the shamisen).

sen.j: この三弦が沖縄に伝来し三線に、そしてまた16世紀に大阪泉州の堺へと伝わり現在の三味線の原型となった。
sen.e: This sanxian introduced in Okinawa was changed into the sanshin, and the sanxian introduced in Sakai, Izumi Province, Osaka in the 16th century was the origin of today's shamisen.
This sanxian, introduced in Okinawa, was changed into the sanshin, and the sanxian introduced in Sakai, Izumi Province, Osaka in the sixteenth century was the origin of today's shamisen.
This sanxian, introduced in Okinawa, was changed into the sanshin, and the sanxian introduced in Sakai, Izumi Province, Osaka in the sixteenth century was the origin of today's shamisen.

sen.j: 中華三味線・支那三味線と言われることもある。
sen.e: The sanxian is sometimes called as "the Chinese shamisen."
The sanxian is sometimes called "the Chinese shamisen."
The sanxian is sometimes called "the Chinese shamisen."

sen.j: ヴェトナムのダン・タムも類似した楽器である。
sen.e: The dan tam, a Vietnamese instrument, is similar to the sanxian.
The dan tam, a Vietnamese instrument, is similar to the sanxian.
The dan tam, a Vietnamese instrument, is similar to the sanxian.

sen.j: アメリカなど欧米ではバンジョーに比較される。
sen.e: In Western countries, including the United States, the sanxian is compared with the banjo.
The sanxian compares to the banjo of Western countries, including the United States.
The sanxian compares to the banjo of Western countries, including the United States.
